template.name: Service PostgreSQL
template.description:
PostgreSQL engine monitoring over Zabbix agent.
#### Version: (devel) URL: https://github.com/kloczek/zabbix-templates/tree/master/Service%20PostgreSQL
#### Macros used by template: | Macro | Default value | Description | | :-- | :-- | :-- | | {$SVC_PSQL_HOST} | localhost | Hostname of the Postgresql service to monitor | | {$SVC_PSQL_PORT} | 5432 | TCP port on which is listening monitored PostgreSQL | | {$SVC_PSQL_PROC} | postgres | PosgreSQL process name |
#### Notes: * Tested on PosgreSQL 9.5
* By default this template is monitoring the engine working on localhost * To be able to use this template on a host you need to setup a monitoring account with the proper privileges * To add such account you can use below queries: ``` su - postgres "createuser monitoring" su - postgres psql " ``` * PostgreSQL 9.5 documentation about monitoring: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.6/monitoring-stats.html

item.name: backends::connected
item.description:
Returns the total number of backend connections (including the check query itself).
Accepts the default connection parameters plus the following: Database: count only the given database name or OID User: count only the given user name or OID Client: count only the given IP address or hostname Waiting: true|false count only backends waiting on a lock.

item.name: backends::connections available
item.description: Returns the total number of available backend connections remaining (excluding the check query itself).

item.name: backends::connections used %
item.description: Returns the total number of used backend connections as a ratio of the total available.

item.name: buffers::allocated
item.description: Number of buffers allocated.

item.name: buffers::written
item.description: Number of buffers written directly by a backend.

item.name: backend::fsync
item.description: Number of times a backend had to execute its own fsync call (normally the background writer handles those even when the backend does its own write)

item.name: buffers::written checkpoints
item.description: Number of buffers written during checkpoints.

item.name: buffers::written background
item.description: Number of buffers written by the background writer

item.name: Checkpoints performed on request
item.description: Number of requested checkpoints that have been performed

item.name: Checkpoints performed on schedule
item.description: Number of scheduled checkpoints that have been performed

item.name: Average interval between checkpoints
item.description: Returns the average interval in seconds between each checkpoint that has occurred since statistics were reset, or 0 if no checkpoints have occurred.

item.name: Checkpoint sync time
item.description: Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are synchronized to disk, in milliseconds

item.name: Checkpoint time
item.description: Returns the percentage of time spent writing or syncing checkpoints since statistics were reset.

item.name: Checkpoint write time
item.description: Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are written to disk, in milliseconds

item.name: Server responding
item.description:
Returns 1 on successful connection, otherwise 0.
Accepts only the default connection parameters. NOTE: If you are using connection pooling, this parameter should bypass the connection pooler and connect directly to your PostgreSQL server. Create a second item key to check the availability of your connection pooler.

item.name: Database transaction ID age (oldest)
item.description: Returns the age (as a transaction count) of the oldest Transaction ID for all readable databases.

item.name: Background writer stops
item.description: Number of times the background writer stopped a cleaning scan because it had written too many buffers

item.name: version::module
item.description: Returns the version string for the installed PostgreSQL agent module.

item.name: Prepared transaction age
item.description: Returns the age of the oldest transaction that is currently prepared for two phase commit.

item.name: Prepared transaction count
item.description: Returns the number of transactions that are currently prepared for two phase commit.

item.name: Prepared transaction used %
item.description: Returns the number of transactions that are currently prepared for two phase commit as a percentage of the maximum available prepared transactions.

item.name: Longest running query
item.description: The duration in seconds of the longest running, currently active query for all databases.

item.name: Server start time
item.description:
Returns the UTC timestamp that the PostgreSQL server process started.
Accepts only the default connection parameters.

item.name: Background writer statistics last reset
item.description: Time at which the background writer statistics were last reset

item.name: Uptime
item.description:
Returns the number of seconds since the PostgreSQL server process started
Accepts only the default connection parameters.

item.name: PROC::$1
item.description: Number PostgreSQL processes.

item.name: version
item.description: The PostgreSQL server version.

discovery_rule.name: PostgreSQL::DB:
discovery_rule.description: Discover all databases available for connection.

item_prototype.name: disk block hits/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of times disk blocks were found already in the buffer cache, so that a read was not necessary (this only includes hits in the PostgreSQL buffer cache, not the operating system's file system cache)

item_prototype.name: disk blocks read/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of disk blocks read in this database

item_prototype.name: time spent reading data on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Time spent reading data file blocks by backends in this database, in seconds

item_prototype.name: time spent writing data on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Time spent writing data file blocks by backends in this database, in seconds

item_prototype.name: conflicts/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of queries canceled due to conflicts with recovery in this database. (Conflicts occur only on standby servers; see pg_stat_database_conflicts for details.)

item_prototype.name: deadlocks {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of deadlocks detected in this database

item_prototype.name: backends connected on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of backends currently connected to this database. This is the only column in this view that returns a value reflecting current state; all other columns return the accumulated values since the last reset.

item_prototype.name: statistics last reset on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Time at which these statistics were last reset

item_prototype.name: temp data write/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created, and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.

item_prototype.name: temp files created/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of temporary files created by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created (e.g., sorting or hashing), and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.

item_prototype.name: rows deleted/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows deleted by queries in this database

item_prototype.name: rows fetched by bitmap scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows fetched by queries in this database

item_prototype.name: rows inserted/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows inserted by queries in this database

item_prototype.name: rows returned by sequential scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows returned by queries in this database

item_prototype.name: rows updated/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows updated by queries in this database

item_prototype.name: ransactions committed/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been committed

item_prototype.name: transactions rolled back/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been rolled back

item_prototype.name: transaction ID age on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description:
Returns the age (as a transaction count) of the current Transactions ID for this database.
Requires libzbxpgsql v1.0.0 or above.

item_prototype.name: oldest prepared transaction on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description:
Returns the age of the oldest transaction that is currently prepared for two phase commit on this database.
Requires libzbxpgsql v1.0.0 or above.

item_prototype.name: transactions prepared on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description:
Returns the number of transactions that are currently prepared for two phase commit on this database.
Requires libzbxpgsql v1.0.0 or above.

item_prototype.name: longest running query on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description:
The duration in seconds of the longest running, currently active query for database {#DATABASE}.
Requires libzbxpgsql v1.0.0 or above.

item_prototype.name: index scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of index scans initiated for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: live rows fetched by indexes/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of live rows fetched by index scans for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: estimated dead rows on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Estimated number of dead rows for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: estimated live rows on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Estimated number of live rows for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: estimated modified rows since analyze on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Estimated number of rows modified since tables were analyzed in this database.

item_prototype.name: rows deleted/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows deleted for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: rows hot updated on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows HOT updated (i.e., with no separate index update required) for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: rows inserted/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows inserted for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: rows updated/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows updated for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: estimated row count on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Estimated number of rows for all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: sequential scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of sequential scans initiated on all tables in this database.

item_prototype.name: live rows fetched by scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of live rows fetched by sequential scans for all tables in this database.

discovery_rule.name: PostgreSQL::Indexes:
discovery_rule.description: Discover all indexes available to the connected user

item_prototype.name: Index buffer hits {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of buffer hits in this index

item_prototype.name: Index blocks read/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of disk blocks read from this index

item_prototype.name: Index scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of index scans initiated on this index

item_prototype.name: Index fetched/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of live table rows fetched by simple index scans using this index

item_prototype.name: Index entries returned/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of index entries returned by scans on this index

discovery_rule.name: PostgreSQL::Settings:
discovery_rule.description:
Discovers all known configuration settings.
Accepts only the default connection parameters.
Requires libzbxpgsql v1.0.0 or above.

item_prototype.name: PostgreSQL Setting: {#SETTING}

discovery_rule.name: PostgreSQL::Tables:
discovery_rule.description: Discovery PostgreSQL Tables available to the connected user

item_prototype.name: Table analyze count on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of times this table has been manually analyzed

item_prototype.name: Table autoanalyze count on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of times this table has been analyzed by the autovacuum daemon

item_prototype.name: Table autovacuum count on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of times this table has been vacuumed by the autovacuum daemon

item_prototype.name: Table index scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of index scans initiated on this table.

item_prototype.name: Table live rows fetched by indexes/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of live rows fetched by index scans

item_prototype.name: Table last analyze on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Last time at which this table was manually analyzed

item_prototype.name: Table last auto-analyze on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Last time at which this table was analyzed by the autovacuum daemon

item_prototype.name: Table last auto-vacuum on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Last time at which this table was vacuumed by the autovacuum daemon

item_prototype.name: Table last manual vacuum on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Last time at which this table was manually vacuumed (not counting VACUUM FULL)

item_prototype.name: Table estimated dead rows on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Estimated number of dead rows

item_prototype.name: Table estimated live rows on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Estimated number of live rows

item_prototype.name: Table rows deleted/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows deleted

item_prototype.name: Table rows hot updated on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows HOT updated (i.e., with no separate index update required)

item_prototype.name: Table rows inserted/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows inserted

item_prototype.name: Table rows updated/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of rows updated

item_prototype.name: Table sequential scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of sequential scans initiated on this table

item_prototype.name: Table live rows fetched by scans/sec on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of live rows fetched by sequential scans

item_prototype.name: Table manual vacuum count on {#PATH}
item_prototype.description: Number of times this table has been manually vacuumed (not counting VACUUM FULL)

trigger.name: SVC::PostgreSQL::version has changed to {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
trigger.description: The PostgreSQL engine version has been changed.

trigger.name: SVC::PostgreSQL Backend connections are exhausted
trigger.description:
Less than {$PG_BACKENDS_CRIT} backends connections are available.
Investigate the issue immediately and consider increasing max_connections.

trigger.name: SVC::PostgreSQL Prepared transactions are near exhaustion
trigger.description:
80% of the maximum configured prepared transactions are in use.
Investigate the issue and consider increasing max_prepared_transactions.

trigger.name: SVC::PostgreSQL Server has just been restarted
SVC::PostgreSQL Transaction IDs are exhausted
trigger.description:
Less than 1 million (0.0005%) Transactions IDs are remaining for allocation.
Perform a VACUUM immediately to reset the available Transaction IDs and review your auto-vacuum policy.

trigger.name: SVC::PostgreSQL Transaction IDs are near exhaustion
trigger.description:
Less than 10 million (0.04%) Transactions IDs are remaining for allocation.
Perform a VACUUM as soon a possible to reset the available Transaction IDs and review your auto-vacuum policy.

trigger.name: SVC::PostgreSQL unreachable for the last 3 polls
